meanings.def: to one side; out of the way
examples: Stand aside and let these people pass.
He took me aside (= away from a group of people) to give me some advice.
(figurative) Leaving aside (= not considering at this stage) the cost of the scheme, let us examine its benefits.
All our protests were brushed aside (= ignored).
We set aside some money for repairs.

meanings.def: used after nouns to say that except for one thing, something is true
examples: Money worries aside, things are going well.

meanings.def: something that a character in a play says to the audience, but that the other characters on stage are not intended to hear
examples: Shakespeare’s use of asides and soliloquies

meanings.def: a remark, often made in a low voice, that is not intended to be heard by everyone present
examples: He made several mocking asides about the inadequacy of women.

meanings.def: a remark that is not directly connected with the main subject that is being discussed
examples: I mention it only as an aside.
